Subject: seed transformations

I'm trying to wrap my head around the following observations about the
seeds in a crawl I did.

- The original seed list has 280 URLs.

- The seed list after the crawl died (the cause since fixed in HEAD)
  has 304 URLs.

- The WUI seed report contains 300 URLs.

- If I extract the seeds from the crawl.log (by taking entries with an
  empty discovery path) there are 277 URLs.

Now, when I examine the original seed list I found that there are 3
URLs that are syntactically invalid. There is one that has a host name
which is capitalized, and which gets rewritten to lowercase.

Most confusing is the difference between the seed report and the
crawl.log --- where did the 23 URLs go?

I understand that the redirects get added to the seed list, and this
accounts for the 304, mostly. (Actually I can account for 303 this
way.)

Perhaps I shouldn't care about this, but the project I'm working on
requires me to give detailed reports about the final disposition of
each seed URL, and these different numbers are confusing me. Can
someone elucidate on the different ways these values might differ? I
assume there is some method for tracing the handling of each and every
seed?

Thanks in advance,

    -tree
